result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Key was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants payment plan of $50 per month beginning April 1, 2017. Failure to pay will result in one day in jail for every $25 outstanding.
Defendant to submit DNA sample within 30 days.

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew J Key

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Matthew J Key in court with Attorney Buckett.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State makes recommendation. Counsel addresses court. Court renders sentence.
Sentencing hearing on March 9, 2017 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Matthew J Key in court.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court examines defendant. Defendant requests to represent himself and proceed to sentencing. State makes recommendation, probation for one year with conditions. Defendant requests to have an attorney. Sentencing hearing rescheduled.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 9, 2017 at 01:45 pm.
Sentencing hearing on January 18, 2017 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Matthew J Key in court.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State's motion to revoke deferred prosecution agreement. Defendant requests to represent himself. For purposes of today, case may proceed. State addresses court, defendant has not complied with agreement. Defendant addresses court. Court revokes DPA.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 18, 2017 at 11:00 am.
Attorney Buckett notified the court that he no longer represents defendant. Clerk left message with defendant to contact SPD, providing their phone number.
Motion hearing on December 8, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
to Terminate DPA.  Forwarded as document for review to Branch 2 Clerk.
Counsel provided the court with assessment facility. Name of facility included on DPA and forwarded to Judge to review/sign.

Defendant Matthew J Key in court with attorney Robert Buckett.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deferred Prosecution Agreement filed. Court examines defendant and accepts plea. Court withholds finding of guilty. Program has not been agreed upon. Once program is decided, counsel to notify clerk by email; program to be included on agreement and court will then execute agreement.
Defendant's Authorization for Defense Counsel to Appear
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Robert Buckett in court by authorization.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Buckett requests adjournment for dispo. State requests plea/sentencing date with co-defendants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
conditions:   Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription.

Defendant Matthew J Key in court with attorney Robert Buckett.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Criminal complaint provided to counsel. Counsel waives reading and enters not guilty plea. State requests $500 signature bond with conditions. Court sets bail.  Further proceedings scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 11:00 am.
